page.title: 18HULLS ART GALLERIES
page.content: The main art gallery in Hull is the Ferens gallery, built by industrialist Thomas Ferens. It is built in the Corinthian style with its rooms around a central court with a balcony. The permanent collection has 300 oil paintings and about the same number of etchings often with a maritime theme. The gallery is a very popular place not only because of its works of art but also because it offers peace and quiet. Every year it has some 163,000 visitors. The other gallery has only recently come under the City councils banner and that is the Posterngate gallery in the centre of the Old Town. It was taken over from the Lincolnshire and Humberside Arts Council in April 1984 and hosts Traveling Exhibitions. 20,005 people visited it between April and December 1984.
